result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
8:36 AM Defendant Donald R McRae in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Yolanda J. Tienstra in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Teri Strohschein appears for the SPD office. Discussion held. Court sets another RH, PH to remain on calendar.
Review hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Review hearing on November 9, 2022 at 08:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Donald R McRae
Current: c/o Dodge County Jail, 216 W Center St, Juneau, WI 53039 United States  (Effective: 10-31-2022)
Prior: 301 Spring St, Fox Lake, WI 53933

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

12:55 PM Defendant Donald R McRae appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Teri Strohschein (eligible) appeared by video for Donald R McRae.  Prosecuting attorney Robert G. Barrington in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $5000 Cash bond with conditions: Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Review hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 08:15 am.
